title: Puberty blockers: what you need to know

content.text: The government has confirmed that the existing emergency measures restricting the sale and supply of puberty-suppressing hormones will be made indefinite. This decision follows independent expert advice from the Commission on Human Medicines (CHM) that there is currently an unacceptable safety risk.
Legislation will be updated today [Wednesday 11 December 2024] to make the order indefinite.
The below explains why this decision was made and what support there is in place for children and young people.
